lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
* The User interface class deals with common print statements that chatbot uses.
System.out.println("What can I do for you?");
System.out.println("Got it! I've added the task to your list.");
System.out.println(" Now you have " + taskList.size() +" tasks in the list.");
System.out.println("Noted! I've removed the task from your list.");
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done.");
System.out.println(" OK, I've marked this task as not done yet.");
System.out.println("Sorry, I don't understand that command.");
System.out.println("Error loading tasks. Starting with an empty list.");
System.out.println("\nBye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Duke is main class that controls the whole flow of the chatbot which makes of other classes like
* Constructor which instantiates a new Duke.
* Run method is where the whole chatbot starts from loading the file to saving changes to the file.
* main method which is the entry point of chatbot.
* DukeException is the class which deals with some exceptions.
* Parser class will parse the input data and generate a taskList from the input the file.
* parseCommand method reads the tasks in the input file and generates a taskList so that the chatbot
* can load the tasks from input file.
public static void parseCommand(String command, TaskManager taskManager, UserInterface userInterface) {
userInterface.showError("OOPS!!! The description of a todo cannot be empty.");
userInterface.showError("OOPS!!! The description of a deadline cannot be empty.");
userInterface.showError("OOPS!!! The description of a event cannot be empty.");
userInterface.showError("OOPS!!! Please specify the task number to delete.");
userInterface.showError("OOPS!!! Please provide a valid task number.");
userInterface.showError("OOPS!!! Please specify the task number to mark.");
userInterface.showError("OOPS!!! Please provide a valid task number.");
userInterface.showError("OOPS!!! Please specify the task number to unmark.");
userInterface.showError("OOPS!!! Please provide a valid task number.");
* Storage class will load and save the tasks to the given file.
* Constructor for the Storage class which takes in filepath of the input/output file.
* save method will save changes to the file when the chatbot ends the conversation.
// Convert task to string format and write to the file
* load method will load all the tasks from the input file and generates the list of tasks and
* then chatbot will edit the taskList according to user commands.
// Parse the line and create tasks, then add to the list
* TaskManager is the class deals with editing the taskList.
* mark method will mark the task mentioned as done.
* unmark method will unmark the task mentioned.
* delete method will delete the mentioned task from the taskList.
* todo method will create a new Todo task.
* deadline method will create a new Deadline task.
public void deadline(String description, LocalDateTime by) {
* event method will create a new Event task.
public void event(String description, LocalDateTime from, LocalTime to) {
* find method will find the matching tasks.
public Event(String description, LocalDateTime from, LocalTime to) {
return String.format("E | %d | %s | %s | %s", super.isDone ? 1 : 0, super.description, this.from, this.to);
Task task = new Event(description, from, to);
